pullrequest.title: Refactoring the cmake scripts to use ignition-cmake

content.raw:
I should be more careful when trying to reply to comments using my phone. I meant for that earlier to reply to go to [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/69/refactoring-the-cmake-scripts-to-use/diff#comment-49915441) comment.

I see what you mean about the ordering here. That's kind of a silly thing for Clang to do. Your suggestion would work, but I think the safest thing to do would be `#if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__)` to make it explicit that there's a possibility of ambiguity.
content.html:
I should be more careful when trying to reply to comments using my phone. I meant for that earlier to reply to go to this comment.

I see what you mean about the ordering here. That's kind of a silly thing for Clang to do. Your suggestion would work, but I think the safest thing to do would be #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) to make it explicit that there's a possibility of ambiguity.
